# siudak.com

> Personal website and portfolio of Bartosz Siudak - System Architect, Senior Software Developer, and Entrepreneur

## Overview

This is a server-side rendered Next.js website showcasing the professional experience and projects of Bartosz Siudak, a senior software developer with over 20 years of IT experience. The site highlights his expertise in modern web technologies, particularly the React ecosystem, and features his main entrepreneurial venture, SelfExpo.

## Technology Stack

### Core Framework
- **Next.js 14** - React framework with SSR (Server-Side Rendering)
- **React 18** - UI library
- **TypeScript** - Type-safe development
- **next-intl 3.9.0** - Internationalization library

### Key Features
- Server-Side Rendering (SSR) with standalone output
- Internationalization (English and Polish)
- Automatic language detection via middleware
- Docker containerization
- Performance optimizations (lazy loading, code splitting)
- Security headers (CSP, X-Frame-Options, etc.)
- Image optimization with WebP format
- Motion animations (motion library v12)

### Development Tools
- ESLint - Code linting
- Prettier - Code formatting
- TypeScript 5.4.5 - Type checking

## Project Structure

```
app/
  [locale]/              # Internationalized routes (en, pl)
    layout.tsx          # Locale-specific layout
    page.tsx            # Home page with all sections
    not-found.tsx       # 404 error page
  components/
    header/             # Site header with navigation
    footer/             # Footer with contact info
    language-switcher/  # Language toggle component
    sections/           # Main content sections
      hero.tsx          # Introduction section
      bio.tsx           # Experience and competence
      founder.tsx       # SelfExpo project showcase
      technologies.tsx  # Technology stack
      interests.tsx     # Personal interests
  styles/
    variables.css       # Design system variables
  globals.css           # Global styles
  layout.tsx            # Root layout
  sitemap.ts            # Dynamic sitemap generation
  robots.ts             # Robots.txt generation

i18n/
  request.ts            # i18n request configuration
  routing.ts            # Route configuration

messages/
  en.json               # English translations
  pl.json               # Polish translations

middleware.ts           # Language detection middleware
next.config.js          # Next.js configuration
docker-compose.yml      # Docker orchestration
Dockerfile              # Container definition
```

## Internationalization (i18n)

The site supports two languages:
- **English** (en) - Default language
- **Polish** (pl) - Secondary language

### Language Detection Flow
1. Check `NEXT_LOCALE` cookie
2. If no cookie, read browser's `Accept-Language` header
3. Set cookie and redirect to appropriate locale (`/en` or `/pl`)

### Routes
- `/` - Auto-redirects based on language detection
- `/en` - English version
- `/pl` - Polish version

## Deployment

### Development
```bash
npm install
npm run dev
# Runs on http://localhost:3000
```

### Production (Docker)
```bash
docker-compose up --build -d
```

### Production (Manual)
```bash
npm run build
npm run start
```

**Auto-generated during build**:
- `/sitemap.xml` - Dynamic sitemap with all language variants and hreflang tags
- `/robots.txt` - Search engine crawling directives with sitemap reference

## Performance Optimizations

- **Lazy Loading**: Below-the-fold components loaded dynamically
- **Code Splitting**: Automatic with Next.js
- **Image Optimization**: WebP format, responsive sizes
- **SWC Minification**: Fast JavaScript bundling
- **Package Optimization**: Motion library optimized imports
- **Caching**: Long-term caching for static assets (31536000s)
- **Content Security Policy**: Strict CSP headers
- **Console Removal**: Automatic in production builds

## Security Features

- X-Frame-Options: SAMEORIGIN
- X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
- Content Security Policy (CSP)
- Referrer Policy: origin-when-cross-origin
- X-DNS-Prefetch-Control enabled
- Powered-by header removed

## Architecture Decisions

### SSR vs Static
- **Choice**: Server-Side Rendering (SSR)
- **Reason**: Dynamic language detection, real-time content updates, SEO benefits
- **Output**: Standalone mode for Docker deployment

### Component Organization
- Modular component structure with dedicated folders
- Co-located styles using CSS modules (.module.css)
- Dynamic imports for performance optimization
- Separation of concerns: layout, sections, and shared components

### Styling Approach
- CSS Modules for component-scoped styles
- Global CSS for variables and base styles
- Design system via CSS custom properties in variables.css
